poll_list.title: Extend Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Budget Until May Governance Cycle - April 25, 2022

discourse_list.title: [Signal Request] Extend SHCU (SH-001) Budget Until May Governance Cycle

content.content: Overview The MIP I posted to Modify the Strategic Happiness Core Unit Budget required heavy revision and was not ready for the April Governance Cycle. I would like to perfect it, trim it down, and format it appropriately before posting the update. The quarter is up, and though I’ve extended my budget well beyond its initial term, I’d like to request a one-time transfer to cover the gap between budget cycles. The funds will be used to produce and deliver swag for Amsterdam and other upcoming events until the next Governance Cycle. Requested Amount: 35,000 DAI   Transfers  Core Unit Wallet Address   Address: 0x955993Df48b0458A01cfB5fd7DF5F5DCa6443550 | strategichappiness.eth  Keyholder: @aburban90    Note: At this time, the SHCU does not have a multi-sig.   One-Time Transfer   Amount: 35,000 DAI  Description: Budget extension until May Governance Cycle  Date: As soon as possible      Issue a One-Time Extension to tthe SHCU?   Yes:  Transfer 35,000 DAI to the address specified.  No:  Wait until the May Governance Cycle. Abstain     0 voters     This poll will run for two weeks until April 21st. 2022-04-07T19:00:00Z→2022-04-21T19:00:00Z If successful, an on-chain vote will be held to confirm the changes.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is requesting a one-time transfer of 35,000 DAI to extend the Strategic Happiness Core Unit Budget until the May Governance Cycle. The post provides an overview of the situation and includes a poll for community members to vote on whether or not to issue the transfer. The post does not include any advertising or collaboration requests, and there is no third-party feedback provided beyond the poll.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I’m with Burban at most conferences. He’s doing good work for the DAO. Lets get him paid.

Wait, you want 35,000 for 1 month? What’s the breakdown of the cost? We really shouldn’t just pass intiatives or proposals just because of personal relationships. It has to be objective for the community to examine
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: No opinion on the outcome, but worth noting the duration is closer to two months, as voting for the May cycle won’t conclude until May 23rd, with the soonest possible DAI transfer (if the proposal passes) not being executed until May 29th.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Doo_StableLab:  Wait, you want 35,000 for 1 month?   Well… my last quarterly stream was about $56k, for the quarter that just ended. The $35k is not for one month. It’s for the quarterly gap until the next gov cycle. My timing for this vote just happened to be unfortunate. I’ve been working with Accountable to get a full breakdown of all my expenditures… dating back over a year. They have been extremely helpful. There are still some missing pieces that I want to get in there before submitting the full expense report. Also, my expenditures have been far greater than any budget I’ve received. That said, I will not be asking the DAO for compensation on any other past expenses. I just want to have a complete picture to provide to the DAO as well as for tax purposes.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Doo_StableLab:  Wait, you want 35,000 for 1 month?   Also, I chose to ask for $35,000 rather than the full budget I had previously since this is a last-minute signal request and I did not want to ask for a very large sum here.

content.content: Look forward to see the expense but do think that you might need communication with the community or other CUs if you are spending beyond your budget. Because it might be due to logistics or structure, and might be able to help you cut down on the cost.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Doo_StableLab:  spending beyond your budget.   Ahh… different times!  The reason I formed this Core Unit in the first place, was because I was spending on everything I was doing completely out of pocket, until others urged me to get some comp. The original budget was more of just a token sum… regardless, I didn’t do any budgeting, expense tracking, etc… but that’s in the past. Now… I have AcccountAble working through composing a full complete picture of all my spending. Once it’s ready, I’ll submit it I suppose in several parts? Total expenditures, reimbursable/streamed expenditures from my budget, and a log of additional personal, non reimbursable expenditures (or just things I won’t be requesting comp on). Something to that effect… still tracking down a few more invoices and such… will submit when ready
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Wanted to make a note on this signal. Business needs are important, as is fiscal conservatism. DAOs contain a certain degree of inefficiency by virtue of decentralized community. If Burban is one of these inefficiencies at present, I am okay with it. Heart and commitment matter. He has both and continues to demonstrate it to our benefit at large.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Ah Burdan, the community of course knows and appreciates your commitment and support. However, yes, time has changed and just like federal departments need to be mindful of citizens and tax payers and corporate executives need to be aware of stock holders, we need to understand that the treasury of the Maker protocol is not “Ours”. It ultimately belongs to MKR holders, and we need to ensure to be transparent and diligent about it.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Thank you for all you do!

Sorry for the late notification, but this poll is currently live on-chain. Voting ends tomorrow, Thursday April 28th. If passed, this distribution will be included on this Friday’s executive vote. Please vote here if you wish to express your opinion on the outcome of the poll: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmVdxBE5#poll-detail
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
